timeline.message: workflow tools 500 errors due to parsing issues
Updated comment to be more accurate
Modified so CWL and WDL parsing errors are handled equivalently

timeline.bodyText: As you suggested in your PR description, I think this should be a 400 error.
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: Should CWLHandler throw a 400 as well when encountering parsing errors (such as invalid YAML syntax)?
replies.author: Richard-Hansen

replies.bodyText: The initial commit in the PR handles the errors this way (both CWL and WDL), see here. I can revert back if that seems more appropriate.
replies.author: Richard-Hansen

replies.bodyText: Not sure about the CWL case; in this case it definitely seems like it should be a 400 -- the method is not returning a useful response; it's not Dockstore's fault -- it's a WDL with syntax errors submitted by a user.
replies.author: coverbeck

timeline.message: WDLhandler throws 400 when provided a descriptor with syntax errors

style fixes, added newline to end of test files

Added newline to end of file

timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.bodyText: Why aren't you using this any more? It still gets used in 2 other spots, and it looks like you duplicate the code on line 273. I guess because you're throwing exceptions here and don't want to otherwise. Still, it would be nice if there wasn't the duplication... What happens we we support v2 some day, if there ever is one? If we don't update in both places....
timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText: As you stated, I duplicated the code segment to allow for detailed exception messages. To address the versioning change, added static variable CWL_VERSION_PREFIX here, making the version easier to update.
replies.author: Richard-Hansen

timeline.author: coverbeck

timeline.message: PR suggestions. Modifed test assertions and logging

timeline.author: coverbeck

replies.bodyText:
Oops, I see what you mean. I thought we wanted the stack trace to be available within the thrown exception, which is why I added the extra parameter to CustomWebapplicationException.
Fixed.
replies.author: Richard-Hansen

timeline.bodyText:
The variable name is equals, but you're not testing for equality, you're testing for startsWith. A little confusing, and I'm not sure which one you want.
Nvm, I see it was like this already.
